qas.question: Who was a meeting organized for in 1929 in Atlantic City?

answers.text: organized crime figures from all across America
Charles "Lucky" Luciano and former Chicago South Side Gang boss Johnny "the Fox" Torrio

qas.question: In what year was there a conference for organized crime figures in Atlantic City?
For which family was Charles "Lucky" Luciano a lieutenant?
Who was a former Chicago South Side Gang boss?

context: From May 13 to May 16 in <a2_0>1929<a2_0/>, Johnson hosted a conference for <a0_0>organized crime figures from all across America<a0_0/>. The men who called this meeting were <a3_0>Masseria family<a3_0/> lieutenant <a1_0>Charles "<a5_0>Lucky<a5_0/>" Luciano and former Chicago South Side Gang boss <a6_0>Johnny "<a4_0>the Fox<a4_0/>" Torrio<a6_0/><a1_0/>, with heads of the Bugs and Meyer Mob, Meyer Lansky and Benjamin Siegel, being used as muscle for the meeting.
